resources.string: Leave distance zero if you don\'t need a projection.
Enter the coordinate formulas below using x as variable. If things get more complicated than \"12.3x5\", please take a look into the help.
Could not solve formulas. Please check them for errors.
No implementation found for export to
Failed sending the waypoints to another app for displaying them.
Sorry, the calculation did not result in any valid coordinates.
Some x that did not result in valid coordinates have been omitted.
Please use integer numbers only for defining the x range.
Please limit the value range to a maximum of 100 points.

Great, Locus Map is available. Coordinate Joker automatically preset the settings for best use with Locus Map.

Time for a short intro …

It seems you don\'t have Locus Map available. Coordinate Joker automatically preset the settings for maximum compatibility with other apps (like c:geo).

Time for a short intro …
On the main screen simply enter the coordinate formulas with x being the unknown variable. Select which x values shall be tried, then hit the \'Show\'-button for displaying the points.
On the main screen simply enter the coordinate formulas with x being the unknown variable. Select which x values shall be tried, then hit the \'Show\'-button for displaying the points.
If you have more apps than Locus which are able to receive kmz on the fly, Android may ask you to choose which app you would like to use.

If you have more apps which can receive gpx files, Android may ask you to choose which app you would like to use. E.g. for using c:geo you should select some file browser app which enables you to save the gpx to your SD card (Coordinate Joker intentionally does not request Android rights for that).
Locus will ask you where to import the waypoints. Best create an own folder like \'joker\'. Thus you can easily hide or clear all points at once instead of doing it for each point individually.

If you use c:geo you will be asked where to import the waypoints. Best create an own folder like \'joker\'. Thus you can easily hide or clear all points at once instead of doing it for each point individually.

Locus will show the points on the map, so you may determine, which are worth visiting.
Good luck!

You can then display the points on the map, so you may determine, which are worth visiting.
Good luck!
Afterwards open the file in the filemanager and then select your favorite app, e.g. c:geo.
